intro: Fagraea belukar, commonly known as the white-flowered fagraea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and striking white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its flowers are clustered in panicles and are often fragrant, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural distribution.
